qas.question: Is it better to harvest grain before or after the morning dew evaporates?
What animal on dairy farms is affected by timing?
What does earlier milk delivery do to cows?
Some farmers oppose DST because their farm laborers arrive to work and leave later or earlier?
Besides farmers, what other group of people set their schedules by the sun?

context: Conversely, DST can adversely affect farmers, <a4_0>parents of young children<a4_0/>, and others whose hours are set by the sun and they have traditionally opposed the practice, although some farmers are neutral. One reason why farmers oppose DST is that grain is best harvested <a0_0>after<a0_0/> dew evaporates, so when field hands arrive and leave <a3_0>earlier<a3_0/> in summer their labor is less valuable. Dairy farmers are another group who complain of the change. Their <a1_0>cows<a1_0/> are sensitive to the timing of milking, so delivering milk earlier <a2_0>disrupts their systems<a2_0/>. Today some farmers' groups are in favor of DST.
